footer.description: Promoting access to clean drinking water for everyone in Berlin.

home.projectIntro: Berlin has over 220 public drinking fountains — but fewer than 40 are visible on Google Maps. Information about clean drinking water is scattered and often hard to find. Our project makes it easy for everyone to locate free, safe drinking water across the city.
home.subproject1Description: We created a simple Google Map with all known public drinking fountains in Berlin. Save it to your phone and quickly find water whenever you need it.
home.subproject2Description: We’re working to bring more drinking fountains to quieter neighborhoods outside Berlin’s busy center — areas that currently lack this essential infrastructure — so everyone has easy access to free water.

subprojects.subproject1FullDescription: Although Berlin offers many free drinking water points, information about them is often difficult to find - especially on platforms that are used daily, such as Google Maps.
subprojects.subproject1Details: We have already added drinking fountains from Berliner Wasserbetriebe and aim to create a comprehensive overview of free water sources in Berlin.
subprojects.subproject2FullDescription: Another part of our initiative is promoting the installation of new drinking fountains in high-traffic areas in Pankow.
subprojects.subproject2Details:
We know that similar initiatives have already been successfully implemented in other districts of the city. We hope that by the end of our project, we will be able to prepare a guide that will help residents of other districts achieve the installation of drinking fountains in their areas.

As part of the project, we decided to focus on installing drinking fountains in two locations: at Kissingen-Stadion (Kissingenstraße sports ground, Forchheimer Str. 22, 13189 Berlin) and at the large children's playground on Trelleborger Straße. In both places, we see great need, as many children, teenagers, athletes, and families come there daily. A freely accessible drinking fountain would significantly improve the quality of life there.

about.title: About Our Initiative
about.intro: We, Nina and Maria, are currently working on a civil society project that aims to make information about free drinking water sources in Berlin more accessible. This is part of our participation in the Club Dialog e.V. program.
about.programInfo: About us and the "Informieren. Nachdenken. Aktivierung" project
about.programDescription: We are participating in the ["Informieren. Nachdenken. Aktivierung"](https://www.club-dialog.de/ina/) project by Club Dialog e.V. This program is aimed at Russian-speaking residents of Berlin and seeks to strengthen their political and social participation. The program covers topics from democracy and civil society to practical skills for implementing one's own civil society initiatives.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your personal information when you visit our website, in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable German data protection laws.
privacy.responsiblePartyContent:
Berlin Drinking Fountains Initiative
Email: berlinertrinkbrunnen@gmail.com
privacy.dataProcessedContent:
When you visit our website, we automatically collect certain information about your device, including information about your web browser, IP address, time zone, and some of the cookies that are installed on your device. Additionally, as you browse the site, we collect information about the individual web pages that you view, what websites or search terms referred you to the site, and information about how you interact with the site.

This data is processed on the legal basis of our legitimate interest (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) in improving our website and understanding user behavior to provide better services.

No other personal data such as names, email addresses, or contact details are collected or processed by us.
privacy.analyticsServiceContent:

Google Analytics uses cookies and similar technologies to collect information about your use of our website. This information is typically transferred to and stored on Google servers in the United States. Google may also transfer this information to third parties where required to do so by law, or where such third parties process the information on Google's behalf.

For more information about how Google processes data, please see Google's [Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy) and [Terms of Service](https://marketingplatform.google.com/about/analytics/terms/).

You can opt out of Google Analytics by installing the [Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout) or by adjusting your browser settings to refuse cookies.

• To analyze how our website is used and improve user experience

This processing is necessary for our legitimate interests in providing and improving our services (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR).

For detailed information about the specific cookies we use, their purposes, and how to manage them, please see our [Cookie Policy](/cookies).

You can control and/or delete cookies as you wish. You can delete all cookies that are already on your computer and you can set most browsers to prevent them from being placed. If you do this, however, you may have to manually adjust some preferences every time you visit a site.
privacy.yourRightsIntro: Under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), you have the following rights regarding your personal data:
privacy.yourRightsList:
• Right to access (Art. 15 GDPR): You have the right to request access to your personal data
• Right to rectification (Art. 16 GDPR): You have the right to request correction of inaccurate personal data
• Right to erasure (Art. 17 GDPR): You have the right to request deletion of your personal data
• Right to restrict processing (Art. 18 GDPR): You have the right to request restriction of processing of your personal data
• Right to data portability (Art. 20 GDPR): You have the right to request transfer of your personal data
• Right to object (Art. 21 GDPR): You have the right to object to processing of your personal data
• Right to withdraw consent (Art. 7(3) GDPR): Where processing is based on consent, you have the right to withdraw consent at any time
• Right to lodge a complaint (Art. 77 GDPR): You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.intro: Find answers to common questions about our drinking fountains initiative.

questions.faq1Question: How can I find drinking fountains near me?
questions.faq1Answer: We are working on adding all drinking fountains and refill stations to Google Maps. You can also check the official [Berliner Wasserbetriebe](https://www.bwb.de/de/trinkbrunnen.php) website or use apps like [Refill Deutschland](https://refill-deutschland.de/).
questions.faq2Question: Are the drinking fountains safe to use?
questions.faq2Answer: Yes, all public drinking fountains in Berlin are regularly tested and maintained by [Berliner Wasserbetriebe](https://www.bwb.de/de/trinkbrunnen.php). The water quality meets all EU drinking water standards.
questions.faq5Question: How can I support your initiative?
questions.faq5Answer: You can help by spreading awareness, suggesting new fountain locations, or volunteering to help us map existing water sources. Contact us at berlinertrinkbrunnen@gmail.com.
questions.faq6Answer: We are starting with Pankow as a pilot project because we live there and can better assess local needs.
